content: Bish — Wow, sorry you took it that way. The title was intended to draw interest but I don’t think it’s clickbait. It’s accurate in what it says — the company started “with” the book, not “because of” the book. The book saved us time, though, and added confidence to that path of speaker exploration. You’re right in that a successful company is a combination of factors — good people are actually the #1 contributor to success in my experience. Investment and specific “books” fall lower on the list, often affecting only the rate of success rather than its presence. This story is a description of how one book affected one company, but I don’t claim it to be universal. Every company will take a different path, discover a different “book,” and find a different route to its fate.
